channel.title: Posts on snippets
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on snippets

item.title: digital books goodness
item.description:
Even though modern technology has made digital storage a commodity and accessible to nearly everybody, I still find it mind-boggling to comprehend the amount of information that could be stored digitally.

With the storage space we have nowadays, one could easily host a electronic world of books and literature and still not be able to go through them in lifetimes. In a way, this drove my fascination and slight obsession in collecting ebooks.

item.title: american gods
item.description:
American Gods is my current TV addiction and my new favorite show.

Developed by the same producer responsible for the Mads Mikkelsen Hannibal, it’s got the same dreamy quality throughout, with consistent doses of stylistic violence.

It just gets better episode after episode. Highly recommended - watch it on Amazon Prime Video in Canada.

item.title: movie posters deja vu?
item.description:
Have you ever looked at an movie poster of an up-and-coming film and wondered, “Where have I seen this before?”

Well, apparently you’re not alone - there are recurring themes and more so than you think. From a post on reddit by user pantsfish, here are some recognizable motifs:

item.title: too wrapped up
item.description:
I love Amazon and its Prime service.

It really changed the way I shopped - the one / two-day shopping is fantastic. At one point in time, I was a subscriber to both Amazon Prime Canada and Amazon Prime US, just to get access to the market place across the border (unfortunately the Canadian selection is just not up to par).

This convenience and new way of shopping really creates an interesting problem - the excess of packaging.

item.title: macbook: "witness me!"
item.description:
Earlier this week I dusted off my Macbook I purchased back in 2007 (Macbook 2,1). It’s really an amazingly machine - still booted up like a champ 10 years later.

On the other hand, the software is evidently drawing its last breath. OS X Lion 10.7 few years old at this point. The hardware is still more than enough perform basic tasks, so I set out to find out what I could do with it.

item.title: first post
item.description: I bought “The Martian” on Kindle. I didn’t finish reading it. I also bought some Tim Horton’s Dark Roast coffee. It sucks less than the original.
